_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This document comprises the Federal RMP for the Gallade Chemical facility located in Santa Ana, California (hereinafter referred to as the site or the subject site).  The site is owned and operated by Gallade Chemical, Inc.

The purpose of this document is to comply with the risk management planning and update requirements as set forth in the Code of Federal, Title 40 Part 68 (also known as the Federal RMP Regulations).  The scope of the RMP includes all operations conducted at the subject site that involve the storage and handling of regulated substances.  The only regulated substances stored and handled at the facility that meets the Federal RMP applicability is:

	Hydrofluoric acid (70-percent concentration)

This material is handled in varying container sizes.  

1.1	DESCRIPTIONS OF STATIONARY SOURCES AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES
The primary operation conducted by Gallade Chemical, Inc. at the Santa Ana Facility is Chemical Distribution (NAICS Code 42489 - Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers).
  
1.1.1	FACILITY LOCATION
The Gallade Chemical Facility is located at 1230 East St. Gertrude Place in Santa Ana, California 92707.  The Facility is located in an area that is primarily industrial and bounded by East St. Gertrude Place to the north and industrial facilities to the east, south and west.  

1.1.2	FACILITY DESCRIPTION
Gallade Chemical's Santa Ana Facility started its operation in 1973 to distribute industrial chemicals to retail operators and wholesale distributors.  

1.1.3	DESCRIPTION OF REGULATED SUBSTANCE STORAGE AND HANDLING
Gallade Chemical's Santa Ana Facility is a chemical distribution facility.  As part of normal operations, the Facility purchases, receives and stores onsite a number of regulated substances either in bulk or in various pre-packaged container types and sizes.  These operations are described below:

70-Percent Concentrated Hydrofluoric Acid
Hydrofluoric Acid (70-percent concentrated) is received at

the Facility in a 55-Gallon Drum and stored onsite in an enclosed building.  Operators then repack the 70-percent concentrated Hydrofluoric Acid into 1-Gallon bottles.  These bottles are then stored onsite in an enclosed building until they can be delivered to the various customer sites.  


1.2	GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS
The Accidental Release Prevention Program at the facility consists of a series of programs, procedures and policies designed to minimize the risk of accidental releases involving regulated substances.  These programs include design and operating controls such as compliance with specified codes (i.e. compliance with building codes and fire codes, conformance to the Chemical Manufacturer's Association Responsible Care Program, Corporate policies for segregation of classes of hazardous substances such as strong acids, strong bases, weak acids, weak bases, etc.), the Company's OSHA Hazard Communication Program, numerous standard operating procedures, the equipment inspection and maintenance program (including a mechanical integrity and preventive maintenance program for forklifts, etc.), fire protection, accident/incident investigation procedures, emergency response plan, the RMP Program compliance auditing program, and a variety of personnel training programs.  

1.3	FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
During the five years preceding the submittal of this RMP 5-year update, the subject site has NOT had any releases of regulated substances (i.e., 70-percent concentrated hydrofluoric acid) that have resulted in:

      1. Onsite deaths, injuries, or 
      2. Significant property damage; or
      3. Known offsite deaths, injuries, property damage, environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.

1.4	EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
Gallade Chemical recognizes that emergency planning and emergency response are an integral component of risk management.   As such, the Company, as part of i

ts hazardous materials business plan (HMBP) for the Santa Ana Facility, has developed and implemented an emergency response plan and an emergency evacuation plan.  
 

1.5	COMPANY CONTACT INFORMATION
Gallade Chemicals, Inc. recognizes that some individuals may be interested in obtaining more detailed information regarding the CalARP RMP and various Prevention Program components not discussed herein.  Interested parties that have additional questions regarding the Santa Ana Facility's Risk Management Plan and/or Prevention Program are directed to contact:

	Richard Foisy
	Plant Manager
	Gallade Chemicals, Inc.
	1230 East St Gertrude Place
	Santa Ana, California 92707
